# VASReadResult

**Structure**

The result of a request to read loyalty card information.

## Declaration

```swift
struct VASReadResult
```

## Overview

A `VASReadResult` object contains the encrypted loyalty card information from the customer. Typically, you receive this object only after calling the [doc://com.apple.ProximityReader/documentation/ProximityReader/PaymentCardReaderSession/readVAS(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.ProximityReader/documentation/ProximityReader/PaymentCardReaderSession/readPaymentCard(_:vasRequest:stopOnVASResult:)] method of [doc://com.apple.ProximityReader/documentation/ProximityReader/PaymentCardReaderSession].

## Creating a read result structure

- **init(id:entries:)**: Creates a new result object with the specified identifier and customer entries.

## Getting the entry details

- **entries**: The list of loyalty reward card entries received from the customer.
- **VASReadResult.ReadEntry**: An object containing encrypted data associated with a customer’s loyalty or reward pass.

## Getting the result ID

- **id**: A unique identifier string for the requested read operation.

## Loyalty card requests

- **Accepting loyalty passes from Wallet**: Set up the necessary components so your app can begin using Tap to Pay on iPhone to read and issue loyalty passes.
- **VASRequest**: A request to read a contactless loyalty card and retrieve loyalty program identifiers for the person.

## Conforms To

- Identifiable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
